meanings.definition: A United States coin worth ten cents.
meanings.sent1: I found a shiny dime on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She used a dime to buy a piece of candy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the dime was a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a newly minted dime.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the dime dropping echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: A very small amount of something.
meanings.sent1: He had not a dime of energy left after the long day.
meanings.sent2: There wasn't a dime of truth in his story.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't care a dime about what others thought of her outfit.
meanings.sent4: The chances of winning were a dime a dozen.
meanings.sent5: The tiny ant carried a dime of food back to its nest.
